tn.text: This is the name of God that he revealed to his people in the Old Testament. See the translationWord page about Yahweh concerning how to translate this.

tn.ref: the first day of the second month
tn.text: "the 1st day of the 2nd month." This is the second month of the Hebrew calendar. The first day is near the middle of April on Western calendars. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_hebrewmonths]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_ordinal]])
"the 2nd year" or "year 2" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_ordinal]])
This means to count the men by recording their names. AT: "Count them, recording each man's name" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
"20 years old" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])

tn.ref: record the number of men in their armed groups
tn.text: This refers to assigning the men to their military divisions.
"a leader of a clan"
"help you"
These are names of men. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
Yahweh continues to list the leaders of the tribes to Moses. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
Yahweh continues to list the leaders of the tribes to Moses. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
Yahweh continues to list the leaders of the tribes to Moses. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
This can be stated in active form. AT: "the men whom Yahweh appointed" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
"gathered these men together"
This can be stated in active form. AT: "whose names they had recorded" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: the first day of the second month
tn.text: "the 1st day of the 2nd month." This is the second month of the Hebrew calendar. The first day is near the middle of April on Western calendars. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:num:01:01|1:1]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_hebrewmonths]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_ordinal]])

tn.ref: Then each man ... identified his ancestry. He had to name the clans and families descended from his ancestors
tn.text: The second sentence means basically the same thing as the first and is added for clarification. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])
Here "name" means to "say." AT: "Each man had to say" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
This can be stated in active form. AT: "they counted all the names" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
"who was able to go to war"
"forty-six thousand and five hundred men" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])

tn.ref: were counted all the names of each and every man ... clans and families
tn.text: The phrase "were counted" can be stated in active form. This long phrase is repeated multiple times in the census. See how you translated it in [[:en:bible:notes:num:01:20|1:20]]. AT: "they counted all the names of each and every man ... clans and families" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: were counted all the names of each and every man ... clans and families
tn.text: The phrase "were counted" can be stated in active form. This long phrase is repeated multiple times in the census. See how you translated it in [[:en:bible:notes:num:01:20|1:20]]. AT: "they counted all the names of each and every man ... clans and families" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: So all the men of Israel ... were counted in each of their families
tn.text: The phrase "were counted" can be stated in active form. This long phrase is repeated multiple times in the census. See how you translated it in [[:en:bible:notes:num:01:20|1:20]]. AT: "So they counted all the men of Israel ... in each of their families" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: the men who were descended from Levi were not counted
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "Moses and Aaron did not count the men who were descended from Levi" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
In some languages this is a passive verb. If needed, this can be written differently. AT: "who were from the tribe of Levi" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: must not count the tribe of Levi
tn.text: Here the "tribe of Levi" refers to all of the men in the tribe of Levi. AT: "must not count the men of the tribe of Levi" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])

tn.ref: the tabernacle of the covenant decrees
tn.text: The tabernacle was also called by this longer name because the ark with the law of God was placed inside it.
Here "it" refers to the tabernacle.

tn.ref: The Levites must carry the tabernacle
tn.text: It was their job to carry the tabernacle when they traveled. AT: "When you travel, the Levites must carry the tabernacle" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
This means that they were to set up their tents around the tabernacle. AT: "set up their tents around it" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: When the tabernacle is to be set up
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "When it is time to set up the tabernacle" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
This can be stated in active form. AT: "Any stranger ... must die" or "You must kill any stranger who comes near the tabernacle" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
a large flag
"his military division"

tn.ref: the tabernacle of the covenant decrees
tn.text: The tabernacle was also called by this longer name because the ark with the law of God was placed inside it. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:num:01:50|1:50]].

tn.ref: so that my anger does not come upon the people of Israel
tn.text: Here Yahweh speaks of not punishing the Israelites as his anger not coming upon them. The phrase "come upon" refers to his anger being applied to them. AT: "so that in my anger I do not punish the people of Israel" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
Yahweh had commanded Moses everything that the Israelites were to do, and then Moses had commanded the Israelites. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
